item.title: Dave Matthews Band - Sweet - Key of C
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of C. (Transposed down a minor third from the original recording).
Chords Used: F, C, Am, G, Dm, C sus 4, Am7
As performed by the Dave Matthews Band.
I'd like to dedicate this play along to my friend and former colleague, Rick, who is a massive DMB fan and has attended more than twenty-five DMB concerts!
Tutorial Video (GCEA & DGBE): https://youtu.be/EDYW9HrCb5U
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is available at ukefarm.com.
Do you have a request for a song to be made into a video? First, check the index of play alongs at www.ukeplayalongs.com to make sure your song isn't already available. If it isn't, please fill out this request form: https://forms.gle/84rgm7kFNJWnTqFB6
We cannot promise that a request will be made into a play along, but we do appreciate your recommendations!
Interested in UkeStuff merchandise? https://teespring.com/stores/ukestuff
Check out the UkeStuff Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Radio Public, Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher.
And you are invited to visit my ukulele blog/website, ukestuff.info (free).
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel! Your support of these videos and subscription to the channel makes it possible to produce this content.

item.title: Imagine Dragons - Bad Liar - Key of F
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele.
Chords Used: F, Dm, Bb, C, A, Csus4
Key of F, raised a whole step from the original in Eb.
As performed by Imagine Dragons.
Want to see the tutorial video for this song? Go to https://youtu.be/cTdAiw4Ox-M
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher.
And please visit my ukulele blog/website, ukestuff.info (free).
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel! Your support of these videos and subscription to the channel makes it possible to produce this content.

item.title: Zac Efron - Rewrite The Stars - Key of C
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of C. Raised a whole step from the original (Key of Bb).
From “The Greatest Showman”
My wife and I finally had the chance to see this a couple of weeks ago (bringing our boys) and we both loved the show. This duet works very well on the ukulele and in this key, isn’t so hard. In the areas with C and Csus4, you can also throw in some Cadd9 chords (0203) but the C to Csus4 is easy to do and sounds good.
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.

item.title: Christina Perri - Jar of Hearts - Key of F
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of F. Transposed up a whole step from the original in Eb.
As performed by Christina Perri.
What an absolutely gorgeous song. The bridge is stunning, and the ending going from dim7 to tonic is outstanding. And it works well with the ukulele. I may try placing this in G, which would be even easier to play on the ukulele—not sure how it will sound in that key (transposed up two whole steps). The tricky chords are the Bb and the Bbm, and as things go, those aren’t too bad.
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.

item.title: Ingrid Michaelson - You And I - Key of C
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of C (original key).
As performed by Ingrid Michaelson.
Check the lyrics as this may not be appropriate for use in a school setting (i.e. “do what the bunnies do,” and “spoon.”).
This version Includes some of the color chords (Fadd9) that Ingrid uses but are not on the chord charts you will find on the internet. For the Gsus4, play a G chord and add the pinky at the same time.
The original leads to a final chorus that is not accompanied by ukulele. I ended the play along at that point. Sorry about the chords there..Ingrid switches to Csus4 to C to Csus4 to C at the end and I didn’t want to add yet another slide.
Need to practice at a different tempo? Use the gear icon in the video (lower right) to slow down (or speed up) the tempo at pitch! Need to do so on an iPad or iPhone? Check out the browser called "iCab Mobile" which has a Module called "Video Playback Rate"
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.
